cleaned.title: [BIP-607] Update FTM Multisig to Claim vested BEETS
cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-607] Update FTM Multisig to Claim vested BEETS
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
Payload with PR
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/916

Overview

Originally when BeethovenX was approved as a friendly fork 10 million BEETS was set aside for the DAO to unlock via a vest. This can be seen here in the original vote. https://vote.balancer.fi/#/proposal/0x95db8e797145ad590b467f8dbecb23404c25c2a7090aa8a8d65428ad9f7373fc to receive 4% of the total supply, 250M tokens, which can be confirmed in BEETS [tokenomics](https://docs.beets.fi/beets/tokenomics). The purpose of this proposal is to update the fantom wallet responsible for this vesting contract with the maxis as signers. The maxis will then claim the fully vested balance of BEETS, and transfer it to the DAO Multisig on Optimism. This is to make the bridging process streamlined. For the time being this will consolidate the multisigs utilized by the DAO as fantom is a relatively inactive network. There is no plan to utilize the BEETS tokens in any way for the time being, but an additional proposal can be made to do so at a later time.

The current DAO Multisig on Fantom will not be utilized after these actions unless absolutely necessary after this proposal. The likelihood of it's use is incredibly low due to the networks activity, and Balancer's influence in the Fantom ecosystem.

Specifications

The DAO Multisig ftm: `0xFe2022da08d17ac8388F5bEFE4F71456255105A4` will call `addOwnerWithThreshold` on itself six times, with the `threshold` equal to `6` and the following new `owner` addresses:

`0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17`
`0xafFC70b81D54F229A5F50ec07e2c76D2AAAD07Ae`
`0xc4591c41e01a7a654B5427f39Bbd1dEe5bD45D1D`
`0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516`
`0x11761c7b08287d9489CD84C04DF6852F5C07107b`
`0xcf4fF1e03830D692F52EB094c52A5A6A2181Ab3F`

These can be confirmed via [bal_addresses](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses/blob/4396ca6ee46272111bb6db65e5054af079e58dda/extras/signers.json#L2)

The DAO Multisig ftm: `0xFe2022da08d17ac8388F5bEFE4F71456255105A4` will then interact with the vesting contract `0x8D381EC09356C3F1805c54B2BB0867e8b417DC3a` calling `release` with the BEETS token address `0xF24Bcf4d1e507740041C9cFd2DddB29585aDCe1e` as the `token` argument. 

Once the BEETS is received it will sent to the Maxi Multisig until further notice by calling `transfer` on `ftm:0xF24Bcf4d1e507740041C9cFd2DddB29585aDCe1e` with the recipient as `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` and amount `10000000000000000000000000`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-438] Enable Gauge Checkpointer v2
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/520

### Motivation

The previous checkpointer contract automated the process which should ensure L2 BAL is bridged promptly every week going forward. Since then the new gauge factories on L2s have required manual interaction in order to facilitate the actions. A new gauge checkpointer is proposed to be given the proper permissions to handle all different root gauge factories, add new gauges as needed, and perform multiple checkpoints in a single call. 

### Specification

If approved, the DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x3f63974a377ba4713661ede455bceda6686a0395f8b8ed8701ad1f13bb926c4d`

which corresponds to the role for calling `checkpoint` on the gauges, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L310).

account: `0x0C8f71D19f87c0bD1b9baD2484EcC3388D5DbB98`

which corresponds to the address for the `l2-gauge-checkpointer-v2` verifiable [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/b6a4c7189e039b81b8957257b95d1193fc4d1e4e/addresses/mainnet.json#L1215).

Additionally, to ensure backwards compatibility with any gauges created from old factories the Maxi LM Multisig will be granted the role to call `addGaugesWithVerifiedType` on the `l2-gauge-checkpointer-v2`. It’s not likely this will be needed though since the L2 migration should have brought everything up to the latest version.

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x54f43cdb53a74c7bd91359b21ad8cd82a6a41b6ff8718aea74f1d2b9292c6b41`

which corresponds to the role for calling `addGaugesWithVerifiedType` on the checkpointer, verifiable [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/b6a4c7189e039b81b8957257b95d1193fc4d1e4e/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L1460C57-L1460C123).

account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

which corresponds to the Maxi LM Multisig.

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-312] Set Escrow Re-mapper Manager for Aura
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-312] Set Escrow Re-mapper Manager for Aura
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/223)

## **Motivation**

Balancer and LayerZero have successfully deployed contracts that enable veBAL boosts to be bridged across different chains. To enable Aura to bridge it’s veBAL boost cross chain a network remapping manager needs to be set on the `VotingEscrowRemapper` for the Aura VoterProxy. 

## Specification

1.
The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x6bb341db03eede206e544c654a59ef89eea83bc65fada2cfeeaf18c5c0f76ac0`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setNetworkRemappingManager` on the `VotingEscrowRemapper`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#LL1333C57-L1333C123).

account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

which corresponds to the DAO Multisig. This allows the multisig to call the above function.

2.
The DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with VotingEscrowRemapper at `0x83E443EF4f9963C77bd860f94500075556668cb8` (verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/mainnet.json#L1082)) calling `setNetworkRemappingManager` with the values 

localUser: `0xaF52695E1bB01A16D33D7194C28C42b10e0Dbec2` (Aura VoterProxy) 
delegate: `eth:0x5feA4413E3Cc5Cf3A29a49dB41ac0c24850417a0` (Aura DAO multisig)

This grants the ability to call `setNetworkRemapping` to the Aura DAO Multisig, allowing Aura to set their own L2 boost addresses.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-276] Enable new L2 gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/162)

### Motivation

Balancer contributors recently completed development on new non-ethereum ("L2") gauges which feature the ability to have cross chain reward boosts via Layer Zero. In order for these new gauges to function properly each child chain factory on L2 must be added to the pseudo minter on that network. If this is not done then BAL emissions cannot flow through the new gauges.


### Specification


### Arbitrum
#1
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xc3ccacE87f6d3A81724075ADcb5ddd85a8A1bB68` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x6817149cb753BF529565B4D023d7507eD2ff4Bc0`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/arbitrum.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Polygon
#1
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x47B489bf5836f83ABD928C316F8e39bC0587B020` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x22625eEDd92c81a219A83e1dc48f88d54786B017`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/polygon.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Gnosis
#1
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xA8920455934Da4D853faac1f94Fe7bEf72943eF1` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x83E443EF4f9963C77bd860f94500075556668cb8`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/gnosis.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Optimism
#1
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x4fb47126Fa83A8734991E41B942Ac29A3266C968` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0xa523f47A933D5020b23629dDf689695AA94612Dc`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/optimism.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-309] Enable L2 Gauge Checkpointer
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/214

### Motivation

Since the launch of veBAL there has been weekly manual actions required to "checkpoint" L2 root gauges and trigger the bridging of BAL. This contract automates that process which should ensure L2 BAL is bridged promptly every week going forward. 

### Specification

If approved, the DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x3f63974a377ba4713661ede455bceda6686a0395f8b8ed8701ad1f13bb926c4d`

which corresponds to the role for calling `checkpoint` on the gauges, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L310).

account: `0x343688C5cB92115a52cA485af7f62B4B7A2e9CcC`

which corresponds to the address for the `l2-gauge-checkpointer` verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/mainnet.json). 

**Additionally, to ensure backwards compatibility with any gauges created from old factories the Maxi LM Multisig will be granted the role to call `addGaugesWithVerifiedType` on the `l2-gauge-checkpointer`. It's not likely this will be needed though since the L2 migration should have brought everything up to the latest version.**

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x1b6c47bfcba58391eb7c8e74ea3c377e0d6c62825a6184d59c4478e225110fd4`

which corresponds to the role for calling `checkpoint` on the gauges, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L1352).

account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` 

which corresponds to the Maxi LM Multisig.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal aims to migrate the BEETS token allocation from Fantom to Sonic chain to align with BeethovenX's deployment and maBEETs tokenomic model. It facilitates bridging 10 million BEETS tokens to Sonic and transferring them to the DAO Multisig, reducing bridging risk and overhead.
key_arguments_for: The migration aligns with BeethovenX's deployment on Sonic, supporting ecosystem synergy.
Bridging BEETS tokens to Sonic reduces overhead and mitigates risk of bridging delays or failures.
The timeline metrics strongly support the 'Yes' vote with consistent early and stable support.
Similar past proposals with strong 'Yes' outcomes had positive governance results and stable market responses.
key_arguments_against: No direct arguments against were found in forum discussion; comments were neutral.
The price impact during the event window was negative (~-7%), indicating some market uncertainty.

evidence.quote: Forum comments were neutral with no opposition expressed; detailed technical specs and motivation were provided supporting the migration.
Timeline analysis showed strong and stable early voting lead for 'Yes, let's do it' option with no competing choices gaining traction.

evidence.reference: Three similar proposals (BIP-752, BIP-751, BIP-750) all passed with 'Yes, let's do it' outcome and showed minor price impact but positive governance impact.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline metrics show strong, early, and stable support for 'Yes, let's do it'.
- Forum sentiment is neutral but no opposition detected, aligning with the recommended choice.
- Similar historical proposals with positive governance outcomes and stable market responses support the change stance.
- Despite a minor negative price impact during the event, the proposal's long-term strategic alignment with ecosystem deployments favors approval.
- The recommendation mirrors aggregated forum sentiment, indicating community consensus or acceptance.
